name: Emu
description: The Emu is a large, flightless bird, second only to the ostrich in size, native to Australia.
food_note: Opportunistic feeders, consuming a wide variety of foods.
reproduction: Lays 5-15 eggs in a ground nest, males incubate for about 60 days.
attractions: Popular in zoos and farms for their size and curious nature.
projects_note: Not endangered; some populations are farmed for meat and oil.
breeding: Widely bred in captivity for conservation and commercial purposes.
